tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: In 1973, with no one to turn to, Ann gave up her firstborn son Mark, for adoption. And the story of 28-year-old nurse, Louise, searching for her father who she knows didnt want her.

programme.title: Parkinson In Australia
programme.desc: Take a trip back to 1979 when Michael Parkinson interviews guests Paul Hogan and Frank Hardy.

programme.title: Nigella Bites
programme.desc: Nigella focuses on the kind of healthy food we all need to eat when we wish to purge ourselves of lifes impurities. Think salmon with greens and shiitake mushrooms and Vietnamese chicken and mint salad.

programme.title: Nigellas Christmas Kitchen
programme.desc: Nigella invites a few friends for a pre-Christmas brunch. Featuring a triple cheese and onion strata, a glazed and toasted vanilla cake brioche and an antioxidant fruit salad, which could come in handy for the weeks ahead!

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: The team investigate the murder of a water taxi driver at the same time as Neville receives an anonymous letter warning them a murder is due to take place.

programme.title: Escaping Utopia
programme.desc: A dogged journalist is determined to expose the shocking truth about the Gloriavale Christian Community - but is its charismatic leader too powerful for the laws of the land?

programme.title: Parkinson In Australia
programme.desc: A compilation of Michael Parkinson interviews from 1982-1983.

programme.title: Nigella Bites
programme.desc: Nigella takes a trip down memory lane, recreating the tastes and flavours of her childhood from recipes belonging to her mother and grandmothers. Nigella prepares Italian sausages and lentils, and bread and butter pudding.

programme.title: Songs Inside
programme.desc: A group of incarcerated women sign up for a unique songwriting program, which for some opens up deep scars and for others proves to be life-changing.

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: The team must prove Nevilles innocence after Professor Cartwright is murdered. DI Karen Flitcroft from the Department of Policing Standards takes over the investigation.

programme.title: Grand Designs New Zealand
programme.desc: With the trauma of a destructive firestorm vivid in their minds, Richard and Janet Brown resolve to rebuilding their Ohau dream home.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Ms Mendeleiev gets akumatized into Kwamibuster, she wants to capture Tikki and Plagg to prove to the world that these magical creatures are real. Ladybug and Cat Noir will have to protect their secret at all costs.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Unable to declare her love to Adrien, Marinette turns to Cat Noir to help her rehearse. But their closeness is not to everyones liking, starting with Glaciator.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Suspect Sprinkler
programme.desc: When the timer on Mrs Maniacis sprinkler system is tampered with before the Garden of the Year; competition, the Inbestigators must track down the culprit.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.sub-title: The Sword, The Fox And The Scooby-doo!
programme.desc: The gang help Mark Hamill face a Fox Monster in Japan.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: Bubbles goes on a road trip with the Professor.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer has a thrilling new hobby - however its not as easy as it looks! When the Farmer gets stuck in a tree Bitzer comes to his rescue, leaving Shaun and the Flock to get to grips with the airborne contraption.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors reveal why you need different shaped teeth to eat your food safely by wearing some very strange gnashers! Plus they find out what its like to be a lifeguard in Operation Takeover.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!: Do Try This At Home
programme.desc: Dr Chris and Dr Xand are back in their kitchen lab! Did you know your body contains invisible ink! Find out how and make your own in todays DO tryexperiment.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Noob Cops: The Great Fork-knife Heist
programme.desc: FREEZE! ITS THE NOOB COPS! A competition begins to crown the worlds best gamer, setting off a chain of noob crimes that lead the Noob Cops into an investigation filled with action, intrigue, and noobiness!

programme.title: rage Best of the Charts 2025
programme.desc: rage rounds up the hottest chart-toppers of the 2025 ARIA Singles Charts.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Burgled Bags
programme.desc: When Gary, the schools lollipop man, is accused of stealing bags from parents cars, Kyle is devastated and determined to clear his name.

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: Matron Shipley arrives back unexpectedly and is horrified to learn that there is an imposter in the San! Its not long before Darrell and Sally uncover the surprising truth about the mysterious Nurse Jane...

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: A sorcerer is haunting a snack factory.

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Its bedtime for Timmy but hes overtired and wont go to sleep. Nothing seems to calm him until Shaun accidentally makes a shadow puppet on the wall. Eureka! Theyll put on a puppet show to help Timmy go to sleep!

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: While Saffy is preparing her home birth kit, Patsy is getting prepared to host the prestigious Global Style and Elegance Awards - but after a dramatic incident, things go terribly wrong.

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Eddy and Patsy take the baby to her first modelling job - a photo shoot at the zoo. Jean-Paul Gaultier is on location, much to their delight, but will they manage to return baby Jane home safely?

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: The headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: Kenzie auditions three dancers for the Nationals solo.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: After a defeat due to bad leg strength, the Titans work out.

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.sub-title: The Three Stooges Save Christmas Pt. 2
programme.desc: The kids accidentally destroy Chefs decorated Christmas tree. Scared this means theyve ruined his Christmas, they go on an epic mission to replace his holiday treasures.

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: In an attempt to win the holidays, Chef brings snowmen to life to entertain the kids. But when they turn out to be evil, Chef and the kids have to jingle some bells.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: The Baby Bears have an adventure in the sky while aboard a plane to Sweden. But when the baby Bears are forced to sit in different sections of the plane, things get a bit haywire for everyone on board.

programme.title: My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic
programme.desc: Wanting to help as many blank flanks as possible, the CMCs start a Cutie Mark Day Camp, but are surprised when one of their campers doesnt want a cutie mark!

programme.title: Wallace And Gromit: The Wrong Trousers
programme.sub-title: Have Yourself A Sardiney Little Christmas Parts 1 And 2
programme.desc: Wallace and Gromit are embroiled in a tale of skulduggery when a villainous penguin, posing as an innocent lodger, traps Wallace as an unwitting accomplice in a diamond heist. It is left to Gromit to save the day.

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: The girls awake on Christmas Day, and find that Gwen is missing. Darrell heads out after her to the bus shelter! Once back at the school everyone, gathers together, singing cheerfully - the perfect Malory Towers Christmas.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil steps in to help sell a house for a family of horse-fans in Newcastle. Graham and Jane Hughes five-bed is situated in Gosforth - but despite its desirable postcode its been on the market for more than a year.

programme.title: Fisk
programme.desc: When Helen Tudor-Fisks life falls apart, she takes a job in a small suburban firm specialising in wills and probate assuming that, because the clients are dead she wont have to deal with people.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: rage rounds up the best of the 2025 ARIA Singles Charts.

programme.title: Adam Hills: The Last Leg
programme.sub-title: Miriam Margolyes, Phil Wang And The Waeve
programme.desc: Adam, Josh and Alex return to discuss Keir Starmers Labour government, Trump and Harris in the US Election race plus the weeks events with Miriam Margolyes, Phil Wang and The Waeves Graham Coxon and Rose Dougall.

programme.title: The Cook And The Chef
programme.desc: Simon prepares casual Christmas burgers and white chocolate crackles while Maggie creates a traditional cherry hazelnut stuffed pork and a fruit mince pie.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Beast Boy gets a stack of cash from the Tooth Fairy.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer gives Bitzer a horrible new hat. Bitzer is very upset as he treasured his old hat. The flock rally round to try and cheer him up with a selection of dashing alternative head-gear.

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.sub-title: The Three Stooges Save Christmas Pt. 1
programme.desc: The kids accidentally destroy Chefs decorated Christmas tree. Scared this means theyve ruined his Christmas, they go on an epic mission to replace his holiday treasures.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: Baby Ice Bear lives alone in the arctic and meets a mysterious man named Yuri. Together they help each other survive the cold environment.

programme.title: My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic
programme.desc: When Pinkie Pie thinks she sees Rainbow Dash throw away one of her pies, she suspects the worst - that Rainbow Dash secretly hates her pies. Pinkie Pie attempts to catch Rainbow Dash in her web of lies... using pies...

programme.title: How To Train Your Dragon: Homecoming
programme.sub-title: We Wish Ewe A Merry Christmas
programme.desc: When it becomes clear that the new generation of Vikings doesnt remember the bond between dragon and human, Hiccup sets a plan to celebrate dragons with a grand Snoggletog holiday pageant.

programme.title: Car S.O.S
programme.desc: Tim and Fuzz must restore a 1966 Mark 1 Ford Cortina GT that has seen better days, but the rescue mission becomes a parts-finding nightmare when they find that the vehicle is little more than a well-preserved body shell.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: Its the ultimate brainteaser. If a truck carrying a full load of birds hits a bump in the road, and all the birds take flight, is that truck now lighter?

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Teachers Caroline and Paul Tweddle are trying to sell up so they and their sons can live near the schools they work and study in. Their house has been on the market for almost six months, so Phil steps in to help.

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: When a young popstar is found dead at a rehab clinic, it initially looks like a tragic accident. But Neville is convinced theres more to her death than meets the eye.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Nashs Jedi friends set out to find her missing speeder.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Everyone is visiting snooty King and Queen Marigolds Castle. King and Queen Marigold give them a tour which features a room made of ice sculptures and an upside down room.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos find themselves in a sports hall. They watch a gymnast dance whilst twirling a ribbon. Toodloo copies the gymnast, twirling a ribbon. Chickedy and Chick join in too.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Teddy is nervous for a boat ride on Trolley, but Daniel helps him to be brave! They enjoy the ride together.

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Fizzy and Suds explore a fire truck and station! They see gear, practice drills, and ride out on a rescue run. Firefighters carry lots of gear and do many jobs beyond fighting fires!

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Mr Brown is taking the kids to the circus tonight but where are the tickets? Paddington and the kids must retrace his steps to find them but actually find out how thoughtful and caring Mr Brown really is.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: The Elf Factory is deep down in the roots of The Great Elf Tree. It is almost Christmas time and the elves are busy making toys. When there is a problem with the toys a little bit of magic saves the day.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: With the baby now born, Peppa makes it her mission to find the perfect name. After many failed attempts, Peppa finally finds the perfect name with the help from the family album.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Frizzy and Gemma investigate the mysterious disappearance of several boats in Kangaroo Beachs Barramundi Triangle.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: When a giant beetle steals D.O.R.I.S.s brain, thinking its a nut, Cosima and Big Lizard give chase through the forest. Big Lizards unique skills rescue poor D.O.R.I.S.s super-brain.

programme.title: Play School: Interesting Insects
programme.desc: Its a race between the fast Australian tiger beetle and the slow stick insect! Alex dresses up as a praying mantis for a party, and Michelle and Maurice go on an Interesting Insect safari!

programme.title: Mixmups
programme.desc: The Mixmups go on an Easter Egg hunting adventure, but when Pockets finds all the eggs, can they find another way for them ALL to fill their baskets?

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing is playing Hide and Seek at the creche with Sula, Pando and Coco. Bing doesnt go to the toilet before the game starts and when he needs to go before he is found he has to decide whether to give up his hiding spot.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey and Bingo want Dad all to themselves until they discover he has some gross habits.

programme.title: Mister Maker Around The World
programme.desc: In Australia, discover if Mister Maker can make some googly eye glasses in a minute; in South Africa, find out what can be created from an old cookie cutter and in the UK, lots of Mini Makers build a terrific toy picture.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go
programme.desc: Thomas is tapped to deliver a sealed, sweet-smelling boxcar. When he LOSES that boxcar, Thomas and his friends must use their sense of smell to track it down again.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its Christmas at Peppas house, and everyone is opening their presents. Peppa is so happy that she falls and hurts herself, and the whole family must go to the hospital.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: A Mandarinteryx has moved into homebase and is causing a big mess. In order to move it along, they have to find it a partner, and quickly.

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: Its Saturday afternoon and Tish and Pola have had to come to the supermarket at the busiest time. Both look a bit perturbed as they stand at the threshold of the sliding doors.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: Ms. Kashani leads a road rally where the Dream Factory Crew get to demonstrate their navigation skills, but when Drews overconfidence leads to Moose being stranded on a runaway vehicle, everyone has to help save the day.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Beluga Whales
programme.desc: When the Octonauts discover a pod of Beluga Whales stranded at a breathing hole, they use music to lead them to safety.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee has his Sharing Badge, and shows the Squirrels how to take something and divide it between everyone equally.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: All Mandy wants is to attract more bee visitors to her Bee Hotel than James - but she ends up starting a fire at the Watermill!

programme.title: Play School
programme.desc: Emma and Karen enjoy a berry cherry pudding and play a musical dancing game. Theres more music and dance Through The Windows as a family celebrate Vietnamese Lunar New Year, and we see a family choose a Christmas tree!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: It is Christmas and the children all visit Santas Grotto to tell him what they would like for Christmas.

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.sub-title: The Tale Of The Seed Snatch
programme.desc: When Mr McGregor fills a bird table with sunflower seeds, Squirrel Nutkin becomes dangerously obsessed with raiding it...

programme.title: Knee High Spies
programme.desc: Jeremy and Deena need to sneak into the playroom and shut down Glitchs Noise Maker machine before it wakes cousin Milo from his afternoon nap.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: The Elf Factory is deep down in the roots of The Great Elf Tree. It is almost Christmas time and the elves are busy making toys. When there is a problem with the toys a little bit of magic saves the day.

programme.title: Stick Man
programme.desc: Stick Man lives in the family tree with his Stick Lady Love and their stick children three but its dangerous being a Stick Man as a dog wants to play with him. Join Stick Man on his troublesome journey back to the family tree.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Haps kitchen is overrun by creatures.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Its the Twins birthday party and chaos ensues when their little friends arrive. The Wise Old Elf tries to entertain them, but they prove too much of a handful, turning the Wise Old Elf into a mouse.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: A fence helps the gang learn about connecting.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.sub-title: Miss Elaina is Brave at the Dentist
programme.desc: When Miss Elaina is nervous at the dentist, her daddy and Dr. Plat help her to feel brave.

programme.title: Bananas In Pyjamas
programme.desc: Its Christmas in Cuddlestown and the Bananas are going to make a snowman - if only they can find some snow!

programme.title: Ready, Steady, Wiggle!
programme.desc: You can find fun, musical sounds anywhere! Evie and Lucia are making sounds on a comb and an empty stapler, and they decide to hear what sounds the rest of The Wiggles have found to create a song.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.sub-title: Paddington Gets Locked Out On Christmas Day
programme.desc: Its Christmas day and the Browns get locked out. Will they get in in time for dinner and still have a merry Christmas?

programme.title: PJ Masks Power Heroes
programme.desc: Catboy, Owlette and Gekko are joined by new heroes, creating a bigger, even better team. Good thing too, as new villains are in town. Our heroes will take them on in the city, space and the frozen wilderness of Iceworld.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Father Christmas pays a surprise visit to The Little Kingdom to check on the Christmas preparations. Everything is going according to plan until the King, the Queen and the Wise old Elf get trapped...

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are pretending to hold babies while Mummy and Daddy Pig look after Evie. They ask if Peppa wants to hold Evie, but Peppa decides to practice first.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Frizzy sets sail around Boomerang Island in an effort to break Big Trevs record.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Cosima and Big Lizard have a camping sleepover with a friendly little crab. In the morning, their new friend is missing, but why?

programme.title: Play School: Interesting Insects
programme.desc: Rachael and Teo are building a home for termites to keep them out of the rain! Special guest Sean Choolburra plays insect noises on his didgeridoo and helps tell a story of a hungry termite.

programme.title: Mixmups
programme.desc: When Yapette is poorly and loses her woof, can the Mixmups find a way to make her woofy and waggy again.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are making ginger biscuits for Charlie and Coco. But when Charlie and Coco arrive Charlies done a poo and in all the fuss cleaning him up, nobody hears the timer ring to tell them that the biscuits are cooked.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: The Heelers gather for a classic Aussie Christmas, Bluey gets a new teddy and introduces him to the whole family. But the family play too rough with him and now he wants to go home. Until Frisky convinces him to stay.

programme.title: Mister Maker Around The World
programme.desc: In Hong Kong, the Mini Makers help create a brilliant bug picture; in Australia, find out how to make some jolly Jellyfish with drippy paint and in the UK we see if Mister Maker can make a paper plate hat in under a minute.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go!
programme.desc: Diesel tells Nia that using her special whistle to find Farmer McColls sheep isnt fair, so she decides not to use it... even though its the only thing that can save the day.

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: Tish has a collection of Surprise Egg Friend figurines but one is missing. Tiny tortoise is nowhere to be seen!

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: When their dads twin brother Uncle Ian comes to visit, the two sets of twins face off in a gingerbread building competition... but when they run out of supplies, they have to work together!

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Vampire Squid
programme.desc: Peso must gather all his courage when he travels deep down to the very bottom of the ocean, the Midnight Zone, and encounters the mysterious Vampire Squid!

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee has his History Badge and a home-made time machine to give them a very interactive lesson all about it! Wiill the Squirrels get home in time to collect their History Badges?

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Sarah tries to create a Ponty Wonderland with a snow machine - but ends up putting herself and Peter in danger!

programme.title: Play School
programme.desc: Zindzi and Leah make a colourful, twinkling rangoli and whip up some shaky, spicy eggs! We learn about an Italian tradition, Passata Day, and Through The Windows we see a family celebrating Diwali, the festival of lights!

programme.title: Peppas Christmas
programme.desc: Its Christmas Eve for Peppa and her faithful friends. When Father Christmas arrives down Peppas chimney, having lost his list, Peppa has to remember what all her friends hoped to receive for Christmas.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: The cadets prepare for another exciting Christmas at Kangaroo Beach, but a homesick Gherkinn misses the winter Christmas he is used to, which just will not do!

programme.title: PJ Masks Power Heroes
programme.desc: Catboy, Owlette and Gekko are joined by new heroes, creating a bigger, even better team. Good thing too, as new villains are in town. Our heroes will take them on in the city, space and the frozen wilderness of Iceworld.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Its nearly Christmas, so while Duggee wraps presents to go under the tree he asks the Squirrels if they want to decorate the clubhouse.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea has taken Sprouty Claus and all his presents to her freezer to ruin Merry Sprouty Day.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: In 1973, with no one to turn to, Ann gave up her firstborn son Mark, for adoption. And the story of 28-year-old nurse, Louise, searching for her father who she knows didnt want her.

programme.title: Parkinson In Australia
programme.desc: Take a trip back to 1979 when Michael Parkinson interviews guests Paul Hogan and Frank Hardy.

programme.title: Nigella Bites
programme.desc: Nigella focuses on the kind of healthy food we all need to eat when we wish to purge ourselves of lifes impurities. Think salmon with greens and shiitake mushrooms and Vietnamese chicken and mint salad.

programme.title: Nigellas Christmas Kitchen
programme.desc: Nigella invites a few friends for a pre-Christmas brunch. Featuring a triple cheese and onion strata, a glazed and toasted vanilla cake brioche and an antioxidant fruit salad, which could come in handy for the weeks ahead!

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: The team investigate the murder of a water taxi driver at the same time as Neville receives an anonymous letter warning them a murder is due to take place.

programme.title: Escaping Utopia
programme.desc: A dogged journalist is determined to expose the shocking truth about the Gloriavale Christian Community - but is its charismatic leader too powerful for the laws of the land?

programme.title: Parkinson In Australia
programme.desc: A compilation of Michael Parkinson interviews from 1982-1983.

programme.title: Nigella Bites
programme.desc: Nigella takes a trip down memory lane, recreating the tastes and flavours of her childhood from recipes belonging to her mother and grandmothers. Nigella prepares Italian sausages and lentils, and bread and butter pudding.

programme.title: Songs Inside
programme.desc: A group of incarcerated women sign up for a unique songwriting program, which for some opens up deep scars and for others proves to be life-changing.

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: The team must prove Nevilles innocence after Professor Cartwright is murdered. DI Karen Flitcroft from the Department of Policing Standards takes over the investigation.

programme.title: Grand Designs New Zealand
programme.desc: With the trauma of a destructive firestorm vivid in their minds, Richard and Janet Brown resolve to rebuilding their Ohau dream home.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the latest on todays news, covering whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe to bring you the news you need to know. Presented by Michael Tetlow in Perth.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: Foreign Correspondent
programme.desc: In the Indian state of Bihar, the worlds largest "prohibition experiment" is taking place. Booze was banned to curb high rates of domestic violence, but its resulted in a thriving bootleg industry with deadly consequences.

programme.title: Chopsticks Or Fork?
programme.desc: Gary Bong took the reins at Oriental Palace 20 years ago, keeping alive the family tradition of cooking Malaysian Chinese food for their community. Garys specialities include Char Kway Teo and Chefs Duck.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: Regional Roundup
programme.desc: Live export bans expected to drive up the cost of lamb, a sky high view of Australias breathtaking backyard that youll have to see to believe, and meet the pair of rodeo young guns having a crack at the big time in the US.

programme.title: News Breakfast
programme.desc: Start your day with the latest overnight developments, breaking news and the days top stories. Emma Rebellato and Olivia Caisley bring you news and interviews, joined by Luke Siddham Dundon, Johnson Raela and Claudia Long.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you updated news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Johanna Nicholson.

programme.title: ABC News Day
programme.desc: As the news unfolds, stay up to date with every breaking moment. Gemma Veness brings you the latest news, interviews, analysis and original reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons
programme.desc: Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News through the day. We have reporters in more places, to tell you whats happening and why it matters. Gemma Veness brings you the latest news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: ABC News Summer
programme.desc: Joe OBrien presents the latest from ABC News, following todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport and weather you need across the summer holidays.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: Craig Smart brings you the latest news and comprehensive coverage of the days top stories from across Australia and around the globe.

programme.title: ABC News Summer
programme.desc: The latest from ABC News, following todays top stories plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport and weather you need across the summer holidays. Presented by Lexy Hamilton-Smith live from Brisbane.

programme.title: 7.30 Special
programme.desc: Revisit Sarah Fergusons interview with former US Vice President Kamala Harris.

programme.title: Indonesia Down Under
programme.desc: Travel across Australia and discover the culture, food and special historical ties that Indonesia and Australia share. Delve into the connections as we highlight the rich Indonesian influences found in Australian communities.

programme.title: Four Corners
programme.desc: Four Corners investigative journalist Dan Oakes uncovers the secrets of Australias black-market tobacco trade, where arson attacks, extortion, and deadly feuds are used to control the illegal cigarette market.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: We take a look back at some of the best Landline stories from 2025. Road trains connecting people and businesses in the outback; plus curbing the feral pig problem.

programme.title: Foreign Correspondent
programme.desc: The feud between Philippines President Ferdinand Marcos Jr and his deputy Sara Duterte has unleashed a war between the countrys most powerful dynasties, involving allegations of corruption and even the hiring of a hitman.

programme.title: Chopsticks Or Fork?
programme.desc: You dont need to be Chinese to run a successful Chinese restaurant, as proven by the Chiems, a Vietnamese family at Gawler Palace Chinese Restaurant in South Australia where their honey chicken reigns supreme.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: Regional Roundup
programme.desc: Cyclones, floods and fires - 2025 to go down as a year that tested our farmers, one million feral camels and counting but would you buy camel meat for a meal? And meet the pint sized Piastri tearing up the track here at home.

programme.title: News Breakfast
programme.desc: Start your day with the latest overnight developments, breaking news and the days top stories. Emma Rebellato and Olivia Caisley bring you news and interviews, joined by Luke Siddham Dundon, Johnson Raela and Claudia Long.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this Christmas Eve. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news so you can stay connected this morning and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Ruby Cornish.

programme.title: ABC News Day
programme.desc: As the news unfolds, stay up to date with every breaking moment. Gemma Veness brings you the latest news, interviews, analysis and original reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons
programme.desc: Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News through the day. We have reporters in more places, to tell you whats happening and why it matters. Gemma Veness brings you the latest news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: ABC News Summer
programme.desc: Joe OBrien presents the latest from ABC News, following todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport and weather you need across the summer holidays.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: Craig Smart brings you the latest news and comprehensive coverage of the days top stories from across Australia and around the globe.

programme.title: Foreign Correspondent
programme.desc: Botswana has more elephants than any country on the planet. But whats been hailed as a great conservation success story is fuelling anger as increasing numbers of elephants cause havoc, destroy crops and even kill people.

programme.title: 7.30 Special
programme.desc: Revisit 7.30s series looking at the coming Artificial Intelligence revolution.
